item.title: Global Infrastructure
item.description: It is helpful to have some background on the AWS Global Infrastructure before we launch a Linux instance in AWS. AWS currently has 24 regions in its global infrastructure. Each of these regions contains at least two Availability Zones. You can think of an Availability Zone as a collection of one or more physical datacenters. There are 77 Availability Zones throughout the world. We’ll be using the us-east-1 region in this session.

item.title: Launch the Instance
item.description: In this tutorial, you’ll launch an EC2 (Elastic Compute Cloud) instance into a region of AWS. Follow Step 1: Launch an instance using these instructions. Use the following parameters: Parameter Value Region us-east-1 Amazon Machine Image Amazon Linux 2 AMI, SSD Volume Type, 64-bit (x86) Instance type t2.micro (free tier eligible) Instance Details (accept all defaults) Storage (accept default 8GB SSD volume) Tags Key=Name, Value=your last name Security Group SSH, Source=My IP Key Pair Create a new key pair and name it: your_last_name-us-east-1.
